channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Mo√ªsai: Text-to-Music Generation with Long-Context Latent Diffusion
item.description: In our work, we investigate the potential of diffusion models for text-conditional music generation.

item.title: Optimally-Weighted Estimators of the Maximum Mean Discrepancy for Likelihood-Free Inference
item.description: Likelihood-free inference methods typically make use of a distance between simulated and real data.

item.title: Large-Scale Traffic Data Imputation with Spatiotemporal Semantic Understanding
item.description: Specifically, the proposed model introduces semantic descriptions consisting of network-wide spatial and temporal information of traffic data to help the GT-TDI model capture spatiotemporal correlations at a network level.

item.title: Harmonizing Flows: Unsupervised MR harmonization based on normalizing flows
item.description: In this paper, we propose an unsupervised framework based on normalizing flows that harmonizes MR images to mimic the distribution of the source domain.

item.title: Learning the Effects of Physical Actions in a Multi-modal Environment
item.description: However, predicting the effects of an action before it is executed is crucial in planning, where coherent sequences of actions are often needed to achieve a goal.

item.title: Outcome-directed Reinforcement Learning by Uncertainty & Temporal Distance-Aware Curriculum Goal Generation
item.description: Current reinforcement learning (RL) often suffers when solving a challenging exploration problem where the desired outcomes or high rewards are rarely observed.

item.title: Convolutional neural networks for valid and efficient causal inference
item.description: In an application where we want to estimate the effect of early retirement on a health outcome, we propose to use CNN to control for time-structured covariates.

item.title: Input Perturbation Reduces Exposure Bias in Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, we observe that a long sampling chain also leads to an error accumulation phenomenon, which is similar to the \textbf{exposure bias} problem in autoregressive text generation.

item.title: Fine-tuning Neural-Operator architectures for training and generalization
item.description: In this work, we present an analysis of the generalization of Neural Operators (NOs) and derived architectures.

item.title: CellMix: A General Instance Relationship based Method for Data Augmentation Towards Pathology Image Analysis
item.description: To further understand the pathology characteristics and make up effective pseudo samples, we propose the CellMix framework with a novel distribution-based in-place shuffle strategy.

item.title: Image Restoration with Mean-Reverting Stochastic Differential Equations
item.description: This paper presents a stochastic differential equation (SDE) approach for general-purpose image restoration.

item.title: A Deep Learning Method for Comparing Bayesian Hierarchical Models
item.description: Bayesian model comparison (BMC) offers a principled approach for assessing the relative merits of competing computational models and propagating uncertainty into model selection decisions.

item.title: Accelerating Guided Diffusion Sampling with Splitting Numerical Methods
item.description: Guided diffusion is a technique for conditioning the output of a diffusion model at sampling time without retraining the network for each specific task.

item.title: Neural Abstractions
item.description: We present a novel method for the safety verification of nonlinear dynamical models that uses neural networks to represent abstractions of their dynamics.

item.title: Robust variance-regularized risk minimization with concomitant scaling
item.description: Under losses which are potentially heavy-tailed, we consider the task of minimizing sums of the loss mean and standard deviation, without trying to accurately estimate the variance.

item.title: Mixed Attention Network for Hyperspectral Image Denoising
item.description: However, existing methods show limitations in exploring the spectral correlations across different bands and feature interactions within each band.

item.title: A Comparative Study of Pretrained Language Models for Long Clinical Text
item.description: Objective: Clinical knowledge enriched transformer models (e. g., ClinicalBERT) have state-of-the-art results on clinical NLP (natural language processing) tasks.

item.title: Event Causality Extraction with Event Argument Correlations
item.description: Event Causality Identification (ECI), which aims to detect whether a causality relation exists between two given textual events, is an important task for event causality understanding.

item.title: Task-Agnostic Graph Neural Network Evaluation via Adversarial Collaboration
item.description: GraphAC succeeds in distinguishing GNNs of different expressiveness across various aspects, and has been proven to be a principled and reliable GNN evaluation method, eliminating the need for handcrafted augmentations for stable SSL.

item.title: Nik Defense: An Artificial Intelligence Based Defense Mechanism against Selfish Mining in Bitcoin
item.description: However, literature has shown that Bitcoin mining's protocol is not incentive-compatible.

item.title: Which Experiences Are Influential for Your Agent? Policy Iteration with Turn-over Dropout
item.description: In reinforcement learning (RL) with experience replay, experiences stored in a replay buffer influence the RL agent's performance.

item.title: Boundary Aware U-Net for Glacier Segmentation
item.description: Large-scale study of glaciers improves our understanding of global glacier change and is imperative for monitoring the ecological environment, preventing disasters, and studying the effects of global climate change.

item.title: MG-GNN: Multigrid Graph Neural Networks for Learning Multilevel Domain Decomposition Methods
item.description: Domain decomposition methods (DDMs) are popular solvers for discretized systems of partial differential equations (PDEs), with one-level and multilevel variants.

item.title: A Robust Optimisation Perspective on Counterexample-Guided Repair of Neural Networks
item.description: Counterexample-guided repair aims at creating neural networks with mathematical safety guarantees, facilitating the application of neural networks in safety-critical domains.

item.title: Universal Domain Adaptation for Remote Sensing Image Scene Classification
item.description: Empirical results show that the proposed model is effective and practical for remote sensing image scene classification, regardless of whether the source data is available or not.

item.title: Distilling Cognitive Backdoor Patterns within an Image
item.description: We conduct extensive experiments to show that CD can robustly detect a wide range of advanced backdoor attacks.

item.title: Open Problems in Applied Deep Learning
item.description: This work formulates the machine learning mechanism as a bi-level optimization problem.

item.title: Trajectory-Aware Eligibility Traces for Off-Policy Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Off-policy learning from multistep returns is crucial for sample-efficient reinforcement learning, but counteracting off-policy bias without exacerbating variance is challenging.

item.title: Train Hard, Fight Easy: Robust Meta Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We prove that the former disappears in MRL, and address the latter via the novel Robust Meta RL algorithm (RoML).

item.title: SemSup-XC: Semantic Supervision for Zero and Few-shot Extreme Classification
item.description: In this paper, we develop SemSup-XC, a model that achieves state-of-the-art zero-shot and few-shot performance on three XC datasets derived from legal, e-commerce, and Wikipedia data.

item.title: Causal Reasoning of Entities and Events in Procedural Texts
item.description: Entities and events have long been regarded as the crux of machine reasoning.

item.title: Finding Regions of Counterfactual Explanations via Robust Optimization
item.description: To this end, our method provides a whole region of CEs allowing the user to choose a suitable recourse to obtain a desired outcome.

item.title: LoRaLay: A Multilingual and Multimodal Dataset for Long Range and Layout-Aware Summarization
item.description: Text Summarization is a popular task and an active area of research for the Natural Language Processing community.

item.title: WL meet VC
item.description: Secondly, when an upper bound on the graphs' order is known, we show a tight connection between the number of graphs distinguishable by the $1\text{-}\mathsf{WL}$ and GNNs' VC dimension.

item.title: SoftMatch: Addressing the Quantity-Quality Trade-off in Semi-supervised Learning
item.description: The critical challenge of Semi-Supervised Learning (SSL) is how to effectively leverage the limited labeled data and massive unlabeled data to improve the model's generalization performance.

item.title: A benchmark for toxic comment classification on Civil Comments dataset
item.description: BiLSTM remains a good compromise between performance and inference time.

item.title: Graph-based Recommendation for Sparse and Heterogeneous User Interactions
item.description: We propose a graph-based recommender model which utilizes heterogeneous interactions between users and content of different types and is able to operate well on small-scale datasets.

item.title: Affective Faces for Goal-Driven Dyadic Communication
item.description: We introduce a video framework for modeling the association between verbal and non-verbal communication during dyadic conversation.

item.title: A Systematic Review of Green AI
item.description: As a conclusion, the Green AI research field results to have reached a considerable level of maturity.

item.title: Molecular Language Model as Multi-task Generator
item.description: We further propose multi-task molecular prefix tuning across several molecular generation tasks and different molecular domains (synthetic & natural products) with a self-feedback mechanism.

item.title: Two-step interpretable modeling of Intensive Care Acquired Infections
item.description: We present a novel methodology for integrating high resolution longitudinal data with the dynamic prediction capabilities of survival models.

item.title: Graph Contrastive Learning for Skeleton-based Action Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose a graph contrastive learning framework for skeleton-based action recognition (\textit{SkeletonGCL}) to explore the \textit{global} context across all sequences.

item.title: The Projection-Enhancement Network (PEN)
item.description: Contemporary approaches to instance segmentation in cell science use 2D or 3D convolutional networks depending on the experiment and data structures.

item.title: Detecting Building Changes with Off-Nadir Aerial Images
item.description: The tilted viewing nature of the off-nadir aerial images brings severe challenges to the building change detection (BCD) problem: the mismatch of the nearby buildings and the semantic ambiguity of the building facades.

item.title: Box$^2$EL: Concept and Role Box Embeddings for the Description Logic EL++
item.description: Representation learning in the form of semantic embeddings has been successfully applied to a variety of tasks in natural language processing and knowledge graphs.

item.title: Learning from Multiple Independent Advisors in Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: This paper considers the problem of simultaneously learning from multiple independent advisors in multi-agent reinforcement learning.

item.title: Cut and Learn for Unsupervised Object Detection and Instance Segmentation
item.description: We propose Cut-and-LEaRn (CutLER), a simple approach for training unsupervised object detection and segmentation models.

item.title: Compact Transformer Tracker with Correlative Masked Modeling
item.description: Transformer framework has been showing superior performances in visual object tracking for its great strength in information aggregation across the template and search image with the well-known attention mechanism.

item.title: Generalized Planning as Heuristic Search: A new planning search-space that leverages pointers over objects
item.description: First, the paper introduces a new pointer-based solution space for GP that is independent of the number of classical planning instances in a GP problem and the size of those instances (i. e. the number of objects, state variables and their domain sizes).

item.title: Revisiting Temporal Modeling for CLIP-based Image-to-Video Knowledge Transferring
item.description: In this paper, based on the CLIP model, we revisit temporal modeling in the context of image-to-video knowledge transferring, which is the key point for extending image-text pretrained models to the video domain.
